titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James T. Gee papers, 1837-1864
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, May 2019

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection includes family and Civil War letters of James T. Gee, along with Gee's father's letters containing comments on the panic of 1837 and the elections of 1840 and 1844.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: James T. Gee Papers, 1837-1864, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, May 2019.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Surgeon in the Confederate Army, from Selma (Dallas Co.), Alabama.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes family and Civil War letters of James T. Gee, along with Gee's father's letters containing comments on the panic of 1837 and the elections of 1840 and 1844.
